review: When I'm taking notes, I'm in a hurry to get the idea recorded so I don't loose it forever. That's one area where this app fails. By the time the app loads, the idea is gone. Offline caching needs to work and it has to be seamless and with conflict resolution. Any mobile app that doesn't, fails to recognise a fundamental truth about the mobile world: that network access is NOT a given. Trying to edit tables on this app is like trying to hold on to a fish with Vaseline on your hands. Why can't this work like a normal spreadsheet? Moreover, search doesn't search table fields. You have to go into the table to search its content. I really want to like this app. Documents are prettier than SimpleNote and it's not as bloated as OneNote but functionally I need FAST and OFFLINE ACCESS over all other features so I'm moving back to SimpleNote for taking notes and Google Sheets for my table needs. I will take one more look at app for improvements prior to allowing my paid subscription to lapse.

review: Some bad features that need to be worked on: App by default notifies you of "things you missed" which tells you absolutely nothing and spams your phone notifications. You can turn this off but I literally never see notifications for things that are important. In the app notifications it spams you with a lot of jargon disguised as useful information that you have to open the app and check and clear out. Unsubscribing from all of them is a hassle because they seemingly have a different one for each day of the month. Jobs need to have a filter for what level of skill is needed. As a computer scientist, many entry level positions ask for multiple years of experience. This mean VASTLY different things to different companies. Many 'entry-level' positions just put years required just because they are looking for just some familiarity. As a recent college graduate I DO NOT want to even see senior software positions, and recruiters honestly do not want to see me applying there either. Promoted jobs are way to obtrusive, there might not be a good way around it but searching every few days and seeing the same promoted jobs posted a month ago wastes a bunch of time. Perhaps put a time-to-live after viewing so they only show at the top a few times instead of every time. Messaging will break for hours on end. The forums have nothing useful for the issue, and after searching for an hour turns out its impossible to get in contact with customer service because they have deleted any evidence of a helpline. It will take hours of effort to talk to a human for a niche issue. They REALLY want you to use the barebones FAQ that assumes you know nothing about how the app works and offers nothing for troubleshooting strange issues. Its way too easy for scam companies to contact you. Its very difficult to contact companies you have no connections with. It is hard to find the proper route to message companies with. Like sometimes I just want to talk to someone in HR about a job, but the only HR person I am available to connect with is the head of HR. I know they are not about to waste their time talking to me, so that's no good.

review: Everything is great about the game, literally everything, except 2 for now. Remote raids passes are awesome, they make life so much easier, but they are a little expensive, I was hoping the price could just decrease by a little, this is not a huge problem, however it would help. As we've already come to gen 6 this year, there are much more pokemon than before. Especially mega evolution pokemon, regarding that, I hope Niantic takes note of this review as everything is great in the game, its just that before mega evolving a pokemon, the only source of that mega energy are from Mega raids. The problem is, I am a new player, I haven't mega-evolved most of the pokemon. I always look out for raids, especially Mega and 5-stars, however people only seem to battle in 5-star raids. I would always be the first one to enter the lobby for Mega-raids, but rarely anyone would join. Even if there were, its incredibly rare that more than 5 people would join. Which is another problem by itself, as the mega energy is given by timing. Basically, I'm not sure why but many people aren't interested in mega-evolving pokemon. So that leads to new players like me not being able to mega-evolve a pokemon even if I'm willing to spend money, as there's no alternative to getting mega energy when that specific pokemon is not mega-evolved. I hope Niantic reads this review and try to give an alternative or an easier access to mega energy. Thank you.

review: Everything about this app is amazing... except for the fact that the smudge pen won't stay within the Selection parameters. When I use the magic wand, I don't want my smudge pen to be able to pick up anything outside of the selection. Even if I'm not using any of the Select tools, I don't even want it picking up colors from any other layers in general. If there's a setting to change this, it' obviously not readily accessible, because I've gone through the app settings, brush settings, and layer settings trying to find a way to correct this. Everything else about this is customizable to your liking though. It gives you most of the settings a desktop artist program would, excluding some of the more complicated settings. There's even a pen mode, where the canvas will only react to your stylus nib (if you have an electronic stylus for your phone/tablet). The buttons for your brushes/color picker/layers etc still react to fingers/generic styluses, but there's a button to hide everything when you're working on the canvas so you won't have to worry about your hand resting on the screen and changing everything on you. Overall, it's an amazing app for artwork, but the smudge pen was such a letdown that I had to give it a lower rating.

review: As an artist, I will share my honest views on Soundcloud with things that must improve: - Soundcloud has a lack of audio buy in. - Focus on quality, not quantity. - Audio quality is poor in comparison to other music streaming services such as Spotify and Itunes. - Soundcloud must start to focus on a more sustainable business model and act in the best interest of the artist. - Algorithms can be improved. - Stop monetising and get back to the roots of sharing and community.

review: Great app! Here's my suggestions for improvement: --- I would like to see the lane guidance show up much sooner. By the time it shows on the display, you are already upon it. --- Would be nice to know the next turn before the 2 mile mark. The next turn should be shown all the time with the number of miles until you get to that turn. --- This goes along with my previous comment, if the road is continuous, it should not show the end of the road. If I am on route 44, it should not tell me to continue on route 44 in 5 miles, and then in another 6 miles and then again in 10 miles. If the route is the same, it should add them up and provide a total distance before you have to exit or make a major turn. --- Would be really awesome if someone could build in a road grade information display showing the road grade for the next x miles. Example: 7% grade 2 miles ahead for 3 miles. This would allow ample time to adjust your speed based on your load (or large RV in my case). Showing a profile view for the next 2 miles would be excellent. --- Needs to zoom out further when the next turn is more than 10 miles ahead so you can get a greater view of what's ahead. - The app crashes once in a while when trying to solve a route with multiple waypoints, but not too bad otherwise. I like using it.

review: I installed it and no maps. I selected 2 maps to download. Program says its in the queue. 2 hours later, its still in the queue and the car battery is LOW! Tried it again and was able to download maps. So far, so good. The detail is great. Tomorrow, I will use it to see if its better than Google. Revised, I prefer this app over Google! You hit the drive view and it is easier to view while you are driving. The search bar is smaller than Google so more map to see. Feedback, would like the sampling rate to be faster so the map updates faster than 10 seconds. The detail is less than Google which is good, better view of where you are going. The favorite is good except you have to type a more meaningful description and you must stop to do this, same with Google. New/finished street construction not updated on the map yet, waiting. I have turned off the wifi in the car so no ads but I am willing to pay for this app! Good job guys.
